metadata.title: CVE-2014-1522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The mozilla::dom::OscillatorNodeEngine::ComputeCustom function in the WebAudio subsystem in Mozilla Firefox before 29.0 and SeaMonkey before 2.26allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds read, memory corruption, and application crash) viacrafted content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
